Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: remotion

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Prints the list of commands and flags for quick lookup

Arguments.Name: versions
Arguments.Description: Prints and validates versions of all Remotion packages

Arguments.Name: gpu
Arguments.Description: Prints information about how Chrome uses the GPU

Arguments.Name: compositions
Arguments.Description: Prints the list of available compositions

Arguments.Name: --props
Arguments.Description: Pass input props as filename or as JSON

Arguments.Name: --env-file
Arguments.Description: Specify a location for a dotenv file

Arguments.Name: --disable-headless
Arguments.Description: Run Chrome in normal mode rather than headless

Arguments.Name: --user-agent
Arguments.Description: User agent to use for Chrome during rendering

Arguments.Name: --disable-web-security
Arguments.Description: Disable CORS and other web security features

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: Custom location for a Remotion config file

Arguments.Name: role
Arguments.Description: Print policy to be added to the AWS role

Arguments.Name: user
Arguments.Description: Print policy to be added to the AWS user

Arguments.Name: validate
Arguments.Description: Validate the user policy was configured correctly

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: Custom location for a Remotion config file

Arguments.Name: increase
Arguments.Description: Send a request to AWS to increase concurrency quotas

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: Custom location for a Remotion config file

Arguments.Name: --default-only
Arguments.Description: Only print the regions enabled by default in a new AWS account

Arguments.Name: --max-retries
Arguments.Description: How many times a chunk can be retried before the render times out

Arguments.Name: --frames-per-lambda
Arguments.Description: How many frames should be rendered per chunk

Arguments.Name: --props
Arguments.Description: Pass input props as filename or as JSON

Arguments.Name: --disable-headless
Arguments.Description: Run Chrome in normal mode rather than headless

Arguments.Name: --user-agent
Arguments.Description: User agent to use for Chrome during rendering

Arguments.Name: --disable-web-security
Arguments.Description: Disable CORS and other web security features

Arguments.Name: --concurrency-per-lambda
Arguments.Description: Concurrency with which each Lambda function should render

Arguments.Name: --overwrite
Arguments.Description: Overwrite a video if it already exists in the S3 bucket

Arguments.Name: --function-name
Arguments.Description: Name of the function that should be invoked

Arguments.Name: --renderer-function-name
Arguments.Description: Use a different function to render the video. By default, use the same function as the one to start the render

Arguments.Name: --timeout
Arguments.Description: The time in milisecond that a delayRender() may take before it times out

Arguments.Name: --quality
Arguments.Description: Quality for rendered frames, JPEG only, 0-100

Arguments.Name: --scale
Arguments.Description: Upscale or downscale or the dimensions of the video

Arguments.Name: --audio-codec
Arguments.Description: Codec to be used for the audio

Arguments.Name: --every-nth-frame
Arguments.Description: Render only every nth frame (only for GIFs)

Arguments.Name: --number-of-gif-loops
Arguments.Description: How many times a GIF should loop. 0 = No loop

Arguments.Name: --video-bitrate
Arguments.Description: Customize the output video bitrate. Mutually exclusive with --crf

Arguments.Name: --crf
Arguments.Description: FFMPEG CRF value, controls quality, see docs for info

Arguments.Name: --frames
Arguments.Description: Render a portion or a still of a video, 0-9, 50

Arguments.Name: --prores-profile
Arguments.Description: ProRes profile, need --codec=prores to be set

Arguments.Name: --x264-preset
Arguments.Description: Presets balance encoding speed and compression quality, with slower presets achieving better compression. Needs --codec=h264 to be set

Arguments.Name: --image-format
Arguments.Description: Format to render the frames in, "jpeg" or "png"

Arguments.Name: --pixel-format
Arguments.Description: Custom pixel format, see docs for available values

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: Custom location for a Remotion config file
